bits_fields.name: R8_SAFE_ACCESS_SIG
bits_fields.info: Safe access flag register. Some registers (access attribute is RWA) are protection registers and write operation can be conducted only after entering the safe access mode.] Write 0x57 first and then 0xA8 to this register, to enter the safe access mode. The time is limited to about 16 main clock cycles (Tsys), and automatic protection is enabled if it is exceeded. You can write any other value to force direct exit from the safe access mode and return to the protected state.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_RTC_TRIG_CLR
bits_fields.info: This bit is always 1 when the trigger mode is disabled. When the trigger mode is enabled, write 1, clear the trigger mode activation flag RB_RTC_TRIG_FLAG and automatically cleared to 0.

bits_fields.name: RB_RTC_TMR_CLR
bits_fields.info: When the timing mode is disabled, this bit is fixed as 1. When the timing mode is enabled, write 1, clear the timing mode activation flag RB_RTC_TMR_FLAG and automatically cleared to 0.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_RTC_LOAD_HI
bits_fields.info: Write 1 to load the high word of RTC counter, and automatically cleared to 0 after loading. Load R32_RTC_TRIG (actually only the low 14 bits) to R32_RTC_CNT_DAY.

bits_fields.name: RB_RTC_LOAD_LO
bits_fields.info: Write 1 to load the low word of RTC counter, and automatically cleared after loading. Load the high 16 bits of R32_RTC_TRIG to R16_RTC_CNT_2S; load the low 16 bits of R32_RTC_TRIG to R16_RTC_CNT_32K.

bits_fields.name: RB_RTC_TRIG_EN
bits_fields.info: RTC trigger mode enable: 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_RTC_TMR_EN

bits_fields.name: RB_RTC_IGNORE_B0

bits_fields.name: RB_RTC_TMR_MODE
bits_fields.info: RTC timing mode fixed cycle (timing) selection: 000: 0.125S; 001: 0.25S; 010: 0.5S; 011: 1S; 100: 2S; 101: 4S; 110: 8S; 111: 16S.

bits_fields.name: R32_RTC_TRIG
bits_fields.info: The preset matching value in RTC trigger mode, and the high 16 bits and low 16 bits are matched with R16_RTC_CNT_2S and R16_RTC_CNT_32K respectively. Cooperate with RB_RTC_LOAD_LO and RB_RTC_LOAD_HI to update the current value of RTC counter.

bits_fields.name: R16_RTC_CNT_32K
bits_fields.info: RTC count value register based on 32768Hz.

R16_RTC_CNT_2S.name: R16_RTC_CNT_2S

bits_fields.name: R16_RTC_CNT_2S

bits_fields.name: RB_TMR_CAP_EDGE
bits_fields.description: Capture trigger mode selection in capture mode: 00: Not triggered; 01: Capture the time between any edge changes; 10: Capture the time between falling edges; 11: Capture the time between rising edges. In count mode, select the edge of count: 00: Not sample count; 01: Count when sampling any edge; 10: Count when sampling falling edge; 11: Count when sampling rising edge.

bits_fields.name: RB_TMR_PWM_REPEAT
bits_fields.description: Data repetition selection in PWM mode: 00: Repeat once; 01: Repeat 4 times; 10: Repeat 8 times; 11: Repeat 16 times.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_TMR_CAP_COUNT
bits_fields.description: Sub-mode of RB_TMR_MODE_IN=1 input

bits_fields.name: RB_TMR_OUT_POLAR
bits_fields.description: Mode: 1 Count mode; 0 Capture mode. In PWM mode, output polarity set: 1 Default at high level, active low; 0 Default at low level, active high.

bits_fields.name: RB_TMR_OUT_EN
bits_fields.description: Timer output enable: 1 Output enabled; 0 Output disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_TMR_COUNT_EN
bits_fields.description: Timer count enable: 1 Enable counting; 0 Disable counting.

bits_fields.name: RB_TMR_ALL_CLEAR
bits_fields.description: Clear the FIFO/counter/interrupt flag of timer: 1 Force to empty and clear; 0 Not clear.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_TMR_IE_FIFO_OV
bits_fields.description: [translate:FIFO overflow (FIFO is full in capture mode or FIFO is empty in PWM mode) interrupt enable]: 1: Enable interrupt; 0: Disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_TMR_IE_DMA_END
bits_fields.description: [translate:DMA end interrupt enable (only TMR1/2 support)]: 1: Enable interrupt; 0: Disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_TMR_IE_FIFO_HF
bits_fields.description: [translate:FIFO used more than half (FIFO>=4 in capture mode or FIFO<4 in PWM mode) interrupt enable]: 1: Enable interrupt; 0: Disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_TMR_IE_DATA_ACT
bits_fields.description: [translate:Data activation (in capture mode means new data captured; in PWM mode means value triggers the effective level to end) interrupt enable]: 1: Enable interrupt; 0: Disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_TMR_IE_CYC_END
bits_fields.description: [translate:Cycle end (timeout in capture mode; end of cycle in PWM mode and timing mode) interrupt enable]: 1: Enable interrupt; 0: Disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_TMR_IF_FIFO_OV
bits_fields.description: [translate:FIFO overflow (FIFO is full in capture mode or FIFO is empty in PWM mode) flag. Write 1 to reset]: 1: Has overflowed; 0: Not overflowed.

bits_fields.name: RB_TMR_IF_DMA_END
bits_fields.description: [translate:DMA end. Write 1 to reset]: 1: Has completed; 0: Not completed.

bits_fields.name: RB_TMR_IF_FIFO_HF
bits_fields.description: [translate:FIFO used more than half (FIFO>=4 in capture mode or FIFO<4 in PWM mode) flag. Write 1 to reset]: 1: FIFO has been used more than half; 0: FIFO has not been used more than half.

bits_fields.name: RB_TMR_IF_DATA_ACT
bits_fields.description: [translate:Data activation (in capture mode, it means every time new data is captured; in PWM mode, it means value triggers the effective level to end) flag. Write 1 to reset]: 1: Data generated/used; 0: Not generated/not used.

bits_fields.name: RB_TMR_IF_CYC_END
bits_fields.description: [translate:Cycle end (timeout in capture mode, end of cycle in PWM and timing modes) flag. Write 1 to reset]: 1: Timeout/end of cycle; 0: No timeout/not end.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: R8_TMRx_FIFO_COUNT
bits_fields.description: Data count in FIFO, the maximum value is 8.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: R32_TMRx_COUNT
bits_fields.description: Current count value of counter.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved

bits_fields.name: R32_TMRx_CNT_END
bits_fields.description: In timer mode, the number of clocks in a timing cycle; In PWM mode, the total number of clocks in a PWM cycle; Capture the number of timeout clocks in capture mode. Only the lower 26 bits are valid, with a max value of 67108863. In counting mode, final count value - 2 (overflow). Note: Writing to this register clears R32_TMRx_COUNT to 0 automatically.

bits_fields.name: R32_TMRx_FIFO
bits_fields.description: FIFO data register, only the lower 26 bits are valid.

bits_fields.info: DCD pin status: 1 means DCD is active (low level); 0 means DCD is inactive (high level).

bits_fields.name: RB_MSR_RI
bits_fields.info: RI pin status: 1 means RI is active (low level); 0 means RI is inactive (high level).

bits_fields.name: RB_MSR_DSR
bits_fields.info: DSR pin status: 1 means DSR pin is active (low level); 0 means DSR pin is inactive (high level).

bits_fields.name: RB_MSR_CTS
bits_fields.info: CTS pin status: 1 means CTS pin is active (low level); 0 means CTS pin is inactive (high level).

bits_fields.name: RB_MSR_DCD_CHG
bits_fields.info: DCD input status change flag: 1 means status has changed; 0 means no change.

bits_fields.name: RB_MSR_RI_CHG
bits_fields.info: RI input status change flag: 1 means status has changed; 0 means no change.

bits_fields.name: RB_MSR_DSR_CHG

bits_fields.name: RB_MSR_CTS_CHG

bits_fields.name: R8_UARTx_RBR
bits_fields.info: Data receive buffer register. If the DATA_RDY bit of LSR is 1, the received data can be read from this register. When FIFO_EN is set to 1, received data from UART shift register (RSR) is first stored in the receiver FIFO and then read out through this register.

bits_fields.name: R8_UARTx_THR
bits_fields.info: Transmit holding register. Transmitter FIFO included. If FIFO_EN is 1, data written here is first stored in the transmitter FIFO, then shifted out one by one through the transmit shift register TSR.

bits_fields.name: R8_UARTx_RFC
bits_fields.info: Data count in the current receiver FIFO.

bits_fields.name: R8_UARTx_TFC
bits_fields.info: Data count in the current transmitter FIFO.

bits_fields.name: R16_UARTx_DL
bits_fields.info: 16-bit divisor used to calculate the UART baud rate. The formula is: Divisor = Fuart / 16 / baud_rate, where Fuart is the serial internal reference clock frequency. For example, if Fuart = 1.8432 MHz and baud rate = 9600 bps, then Divisor = 1843200 / 16 / 9600 = 12.

bits_fields.name: R8_UARTx_DIV
bits_fields.info: Used to calculate the UART internal reference clock. The lower 7 bits are valid. Formula: Divisor = Fsys * 2 / UART internal reference clock. Max value is 127.

bits_fields.name: R8_UART0_ADR
bits_fields.info: Slave address of UART0 during multi-device communication: FFh means not used; other values are valid slave addresses.

bits_fields.name: RB_MCR_HALF
bits_fields.info: Half-duplex transceiver mode control (only supported by UART0). 1: Enter half-duplex transceiver mode (transmit with priority, receive when not transmitting). 0: Disable half-duplex mode.

bits_fields.name: RB_MCR_TNOW
bits_fields.info: Status enable that DTR pin output is being transmitted (UART0 only). 1: Output transmit status to DTR pin for RS485 control. 0: DTR pin in normal function.

bits_fields.name: RB_MCR_AU_FLOW_EN
bits_fields.info: CTS/RTS hardware automatic flow control enable (UART0 only). When set, transmission depends on CTS validity (active low). UART manages RTS automatically based on FIFO fill level.

bits_fields.name: RB_MCR_LOOP
bits_fields.info: Internal loopback test mode enable (UART0 only). 1: Enable internal loopback (TXDRXD, RTSCTS, DTRDSR, OUT1RI, OUT2DCD). 0: Disable test mode.

bits_fields.name: RB_MCR_OUT2
bits_fields.info: UART interrupt request output control. 1: Enable interrupt request output. 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_MCR_OUT1
bits_fields.info: User-defined MODEM control bit (UART0 only). Not connected to any pin. 1: Set high. 0: Set low.

bits_fields.name: RB_MCR_RTS
bits_fields.info: RTS signal output control (UART0 only). 1: RTS active (low). 0: RTS inactive (high).

bits_fields.name: RB_MCR_DTR
bits_fields.info: DTR signal output control (UART0 only). 1: DTR active (low). 0: DTR inactive (high).

bits_fields.name: RB_IER_RESET
bits_fields.info: UART software reset control bit, automatically cleared. 1: Software resets UART; 0: Normal operation.

bits_fields.name: RB_IER_TXD_EN
bits_fields.info: UART TXD pin output enable bit. 1: Enable TXD pin output; 0: Disable TXD pin output.

bits_fields.name: RB_IER_RTS_EN
bits_fields.info: RTS pin output enable bit (only supported by UART0). 1: Enable output; 0: Disable output.

bits_fields.name: RB_IER_DTR_EN
bits_fields.info: DTR pin output enable bit (only supported by UART0). 1: Enable output; 0: Disable output.

bits_fields.name: RB_IER_MODEM_CHG
bits_fields.info: Modem input status change interrupt enable bit (only supported by UART0). 1: Enable interrupt; 0: Disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_IER_LINE_STAT
bits_fields.info: Receive line status interrupt enable bit. 1: Enable interrupt; 0: Disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_IER_THR_EMPTY
bits_fields.info: Transmit holding register empty interrupt enable bit. 1: Enable interrupt; 0: Disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_IER_RECV_RDY
bits_fields.info: Receive data available interrupt enable bit. 1: Enable interrupt; 0: Disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_FCR_FIFO_TRIG
bits_fields.info: Trigger level selection for receive FIFO interrupt and hardware flow control. 00: 1 byte; 01: 2 bytes; 10: 4 bytes; 11: 7 bytes. Determines when receive interrupt is triggered and when RTS is deasserted if hardware flow control is enabled.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved bits.

bits_fields.name: RB_FCR_TX_FIFO_C
bits_fields.info: Transmit FIFO data clear bit, automatically cleared. 1: Clear transmitter FIFO (excluding TSR). 0: No effect.

bits_fields.name: RB_FCR_RX_FIFO_C
bits_fields.info: Receive FIFO data clear bit, automatically cleared. 1: Clear receiver FIFO (excluding RSR). 0: No effect.

bits_fields.name: RB_FCR_FIFO_EN
bits_fields.info: FIFO enable control. 1: Enable 8-byte FIFO; 0: Disable (16C450 compatible mode with 1-byte buffer). Enabling FIFO is recommended.

bits_fields.name: RB_LCR_DLAB
bits_fields.info: UART general purpose bit, user-defined.

bits_fields.name: RB_LCR_BREAK_EN
bits_fields.info: Force generation of BREAK line interval. 1: Force generate break; 0: Do not generate break.

bits_fields.name: RB_LCR_PAR_MOD
bits_fields.info: Parity mode selection (valid only if parity enabled): 00: Odd; 01: Even; 10: Mark (set to 1); 11: Space (set to 0).

bits_fields.name: RB_LCR_PAR_EN
bits_fields.info: Parity enable bit: 1: Enable parity generation and checking; 0: Disable parity.

bits_fields.name: RB_LCR_STOP_BIT
bits_fields.info: Stop bit format: 0: 1 stop bit; 1: 2 stop bits.

bits_fields.name: RB_LCR_WORD_SZ
bits_fields.info: Word length (data bits) selection: 00: 5 bits; 01: 6 bits; 10: 7 bits; 11: 8 bits.

bits_fields.name: RB_IIR_FIFO_ID
bits_fields.info: UART FIFO enable status: 11 means FIFO enabled; 00 means FIFO not enabled.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved bits.

bits_fields.name: RB_IIR_INT_MASK
bits_fields.info: Interrupt flag bits identifying the active interrupt source. If RB_IIR_NO_INT is 0, interrupt is pending and source must be checked. See interrupt source details in the datasheet's Table 9-5.

bits_fields.name: RB_IIR_NO_INT
bits_fields.info: UART no interrupt flag: 1 means no interrupt pending; 0 means interrupt pending.

bits_fields.name: RB_LSR_ERR_RX_FIFO
bits_fields.info: Receive FIFO error flag: 1 indicates at least one parity error (PAR_ERR), frame error (FRAM_ERR), or break error (BREAK_ERR) in the receiver FIFO; 0 indicates no errors in receiver FIFO.

bits_fields.name: RB_LSR_TX_ALL_EMP
bits_fields.info: THR (Transmit Holding Register) and TSR (Transmit Shift Register) empty flag: 1 means both are empty; 0 means not empty.

bits_fields.name: RB_LSR_TX_FIFO_EMP
bits_fields.info: Transmit FIFO empty flag: 1 means transmit FIFO is empty; 0 means it is not empty.

bits_fields.name: RB_LSR_BREAK_ERR
bits_fields.info: BREAK line interval detection flag: 1 if BREAK is detected; 0 if BREAK is not detected.

bits_fields.name: RB_LSR_FRAME_ERR
bits_fields.info: Data frame error flag: 1 indicates a frame error in the data read from receiver FIFO (no valid stop bit); 0 indicates no frame error.

bits_fields.name: RB_LSR_PAR_ERR
bits_fields.info: Receive data parity error flag: 1 means parity error in data read from receiver FIFO; 0 means parity is correct.

bits_fields.name: RB_LSR_OVER_ERR
bits_fields.info: Receiver FIFO buffer overflow flag: 1 means overflow occurred; 0 means no overflow.

bits_fields.name: RB_LSR_DATA_RDY
bits_fields.info: Receiver FIFO data ready flag: 1 means data is available in FIFO; 0 means no data. This bit clears automatically after reading all data in FIFO.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_MISO_OE
bits_fields.info: MISO pin output enable (can be used at data line switching direction in 2-wire mode): 1: MISO output enabled; 0: MISO output disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_MOSI_OE
bits_fields.info: MOSI pin output enable: 1: MOSI output enabled; 0: MOSI output disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_SCK_OE
bits_fields.info: SCK pin output enable: 1: SCK output enabled; 0: SCK output disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_FIFO_DIR
bits_fields.info: FIFO direction: 1: Input (receive data); 0: Output (transmit data).

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_SLV_CMD_MOD
bits_fields.info: First byte mode selection in SPI0 slave mode (only supported by SPI0): 1: First byte command mode; 0: Data stream mode.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_MST_SCK_MOD
bits_fields.info: Clock idle mode selection in master mode: 1: Mode3 (SCK is at high level when idle); 0: Mode0 (SCK is at low level when idle).

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_2WIRE_MOD
bits_fields.info: 2-wire or 3-wire SPI mode selection in slave mode: 1: 2-wire mode/half duplex (SCK/MISO); 0: 3-wire mode/full duplex (SCK/MOSI/MISO).

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_ALL_CLEAR
bits_fields.info: SPI FIFO/counter/interrupt flag clear: 1: Force to empty and clear; 0: Not clear.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_MODE_SLAVE
bits_fields.info: SPI0 master/slave mode selection (only supported by SPI0): 1: Slave mode; 0: Master mode.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_MST_DLY_EN
bits_fields.info: Input delay enable in master mode: 1: Enable, used for high-speed applications such as SPI clock close to half of Fsys; 0: Disable, regular applications.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_BIT_ORDER
bits_fields.info: SPI data bit order selection: 1: LSB first; 0: MSB first.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_AUTO_IF
bits_fields.info: Enable the function of automatically clearing flag RB_SPI_IF_BYTE_END when accessing BUFFER/FIFO: 1: Enable; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_DMA_LOOP
bits_fields.info: DMA address loop enable (only supported by SPI0): 1: Enable address loop; 0: Disable address loop. Auto loops when DMA address reaches end address.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_DMA_ENABLE
bits_fields.info: DMA enable (only supported by SPI0): 1: Enable DMA; 0: Disable DMA.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IE_FST_BYTE
bits_fields.info: In the first byte command mode of slave mode, first byte interrupt receive enable (only supported by SPI0): 1: Enable receiving the first byte interrupt; 0: Disable.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IE_FIFO_OV
bits_fields.info: FIFO overflow interrupt enable (only supported by SPI0): 1: Interrupt enabled; 0: Interrupt disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IE_DMA_END
bits_fields.info: DMA end interrupt enable (only supported by SPI0): 1: Interrupt enabled; 0: Interrupt disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IE_FIFO_HF
bits_fields.info: More than half of FIFO used interrupt enable: 1: Interrupt enabled; 0: Interrupt disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IE_BYTE_END
bits_fields.info: SPI single byte transmission completion interrupt enable: 1: Interrupt enabled; 0: Interrupt disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IE_CNT_END
bits_fields.info: SPI all byte transmission completion interrupt enable: 1: Interrupt enabled; 0: Interrupt disabled.

bits_fields.name: R8_SPI_CLOCK_DIV
bits_fields.info: Frequency division factor in master mode, minimum value is 2. SPI clock frequency Fsck = Fsys / frequency division factor.

bits_fields.name: R8_SPI0_SLAVE_PRE
bits_fields.info: Preset data first returned in slave mode. Used to receive the returned data after first byte of data.

bits_fields.name: R8_SPIx_BUFFER
bits_fields.info: SPI data transmit and receive buffer.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_SLV_SELECT
bits_fields.info: Chip select status in slave mode (only supported by SPI0): 1 means being selected; 0 means no chip selected.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_SLV_CS_LOAD
bits_fields.info: First loading status after chip select in slave mode (only supported by SPI0): 1 means loading R8_SPI0_SLAVE_PRE; 0 means not yet loaded or loading completed.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_FIFO_READY
bits_fields.info: FIFO ready status: 1 means FIFO is ready (R16_SPIx_TOTAL_CNT is not 0, and FIFO is not full when receiving or not empty when transmitting); 0 means FIFO is not ready.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_SLV_CMD_ACT
bits_fields.info: Command received completion status in slave mode (only supported by SPI0): 1 means the just exchanged data is the first byte; 0 means first byte not exchanged or not the first byte.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IF_FST_BYTE
bits_fields.info: [translate:First byte received flag in slave mode (only supported by SPI0): 1: The first byte has been received; 0: The first byte is not received.]

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_FREE
bits_fields.info: [translate:Current SPI free: 1: Free; 0: Not free.]

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IF_FIFO_OV
bits_fields.info: [translate:FIFO overflow (FIFO is full when receiving or FIFO is empty when transmitting) flag. Write 1 to reset: 1: Overflow; 0: Not overflow.]

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IF_DMA_END
bits_fields.info: [translate:DMA end flag (only supported by SPI0). Write 1 to reset: 1: End; 0: Not end.]

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IF_FIFO_HF
bits_fields.info: [translate:More than half of FIFO used (FIFO>=4 when receiving or FIFO<4 when transmitting) flag. Write 1 to reset: 1: More than half of FIFO has been used; 0: FIFO has been used not more than half.]

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IF_BYTE_END
bits_fields.info: [translate:SPI single byte transfer end flag. Write 1 to reset: 1: End; 0: Not end.]

bits_fields.name: RB_SPI_IF_CNT_END
bits_fields.info: [translate:SPI all byte transfer end flag. Write 1 to reset: 1: All byte transfer ends; 0: All byte transfer not end.]

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: R8_SPIx_FIFO_COUNT
bits_fields.info: Current byte count in FIFO.

bits_fields.name: R16_SPIx_TOTAL_CNT
bits_fields.info: Total number of bytes of SPI data transceiver in master mode, with lower 12 bits valid. Maximum of 4095 bytes can be received/transmitted at a time using DMA. Not supported in slave mode.

bits_fields.name: R8_SPIx_FIFO
bits_fields.info: Data FIFO register for SPI data transmission and reception.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved

bits_fields.name: R8_SPI0_FIFO_COUNT1
bits_fields.info: Current byte count in FIFO. Same as R8_SPIx_FIFO_COUNT.

R8_SPI0_CLOCK_DIV.name: R8_SPI0_CLOCK_DIV
R8_SPI0_CLOCK_DIV.info: SPI0 clock divider register in master mode]

R8_SPI0_SLAVE_PRE.name: R8_SPI0_SLAVE_PRE
R8_SPI0_SLAVE_PRE.info: SPI0 preset data register in slave mode]

R16_SPI0_TOTAL_CNT.name: R16_SPI0_TOTAL_CNT
R16_SPI0_TOTAL_CNT.info: SPI0 transceiver data total length registe

R16_SPI0_DMA_NOW.name: R16_SPI0_DMA_NOW
R16_SPI0_DMA_NOW.info: Current address of SPI0 DMA buffe

bits_fields.name: R16_SPI0_DMA_NOW
bits_fields.info: Current address of DMA data buffer for SPI0. Can be used to calculate the number of conversions using the formula COUNT = SPI0_DMA_NOW - SPI0_DMA_BEG.

R16_SPI0_DMA_BEG.name: R16_SPI0_DMA_BEG
R16_SPI0_DMA_BEG.info: Start address of SPI0 DMA buffe

bits_fields.name: R16_SPI0_DMA_BEG
bits_fields.info: Start address of DMA data buffer for SPI0, only the lower 15 bits are valid.

R16_SPI0_DMA_END.name: R16_SPI0_DMA_END
R16_SPI0_DMA_END.info: End address of SPI0 DMA buffe

bits_fields.name: R16_SPI0_DMA_END
bits_fields.info: End address of DMA data buffer for SPI0 (not included), only the lower 15 bits are valid.

R8_SPI1_CLOCK_DIV.name: R8_SPI1_CLOCK_DIV
R8_SPI1_CLOCK_DIV.info: SPI1 clock frequency division register in master mode]

R16_SPI1_TOTAL_CNT.name: R16_SPI1_TOTAL_CNT
R16_SPI1_TOTAL_CNT.info: SPI1 receive/transmit data total length registe

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM11_OUT_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM11 output enable: 1 means enabled; 0 means disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM10_OUT_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM10 output enable: 1 means enabled; 0 means disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM9_OUT_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM9 output enable: 1 means enabled; 0 means disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM8_OUT_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM8 output enable: 1 means enabled; 0 means disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM7_OUT_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM7 output enable: 1 means enabled; 0 means disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM6_OUT_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM6 output enable: 1 means enabled; 0 means disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM5_OUT_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM5 output enable: 1 means enabled; 0 means disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM4_OUT_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM4 output enable: 1 means enabled; 0 means disabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM11_POLAR
bits_fields.info: PWM11 output polarity control: 1 means default at high level, active low; 0 means default at low level, active high.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM10_POLAR
bits_fields.info: PWM10 output polarity control: 1 means default at high level, active low; 0 means default at low level, active high.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM9_POLAR
bits_fields.info: PWM9 output polarity control: 1 means default at high level, active low; 0 means default at low level, active high.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM8_POLAR
bits_fields.info: PWM8 output polarity control: 1 means default at high level, active low; 0 means default at low level, active high.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM7_POLAR
bits_fields.info: PWM7 output polarity control: 1 means default at high level, active low; 0 means default at low level, active high.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM6_POLAR
bits_fields.info: PWM6 output polarity control: 1 means default at high level, active low; 0 means default at low level, active high.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM5_POLAR
bits_fields.info: PWM5 output polarity control: 1 means default at high level, active low; 0 means default at low level, active high.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM4_POLAR
bits_fields.info: PWM4 output polarity control: 1 means default at high level, active low; 0 means default at low level, active high.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM10_11_STAG_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM10/11 interleaved output enable: 1 means interleaved output; 0 means independent output.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM8_9_STAG_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM8/9 interleaved output enable: 1 means interleaved output; 0 means independent output.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM6_7_STAG_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM6/7 interleaved output enable: 1 means interleaved output; 0 means independent output.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM4_5_STAG_EN
bits_fields.info: PWM4/5 interleaved output enable: 1 means interleaved output; 0 means independent output.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM_CYC_MOD
bits_fields.info: PWM data width selection: 00 means 8-bit width; 01 means 7-bit width; 10 means 6-bit width; 11 means 5-bit width.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM_STAG_ST
bits_fields.info: PWM interleave flag: 1 means PWM5/7/9/11 allowed to output; 0 means PWM4/6/8/10 allowed to output.

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM_CYCLE_SEL
bits_fields.info: PWM period selection: 0 means 8/7/6-bit data width corresponding to 256/128/64 clock cycles; 1 means 8/7/6-bit data width corresponding to 255/127/63 clock cycles. The 16-bit data width corresponds to clock cycles controlled by R32_PWM_REG_CYCLE.

bits_fields.name: R8_PWM_CLOCK_DIV
bits_fields.info: PWM reference clock frequency division factor. PWM frequency Fpwm = system clock frequency Fsys divided by R8_PWM_CLOCK_DIV.

bits_fields.name: R8_PWM7_DATA
bits_fields.info: PWM7 data hold register.

bits_fields.name: R8_PWM6_DATA
bits_fields.info: PWM6 data hold register.

bits_fields.name: R8_PWM5_DATA
bits_fields.info: PWM5 data hold register.

bits_fields.name: R8_PWM4_DATA
bits_fields.info: PWM4 data hold register.

bits_fields.name: R16_PWM5_DATA
bits_fields.info: PWM5 data hold register (16-bit width).

bits_fields.name: R16_PWM4_DATA
bits_fields.info: PWM4 data hold register (16-bit width).

bits_fields.name: R8_PWM11_DATA
bits_fields.description: PWM11 data hold register.

bits_fields.name: R8_PWM10_DATA
bits_fields.description: PWM10 data hold register.

bits_fields.name: R8_PWM9_DATA
bits_fields.description: PWM9 data hold register.

bits_fields.name: R8_PWM8_DATA
bits_fields.description: PWM8 data hold register.

bits_fields.name: R16_PWM7_DATA
bits_fields.description: PWM7 data hold register (16-bit width).

bits_fields.name: R16_PWM6_DATA
bits_fields.description: PWM6 data hold register (16-bit width).

R8_PWM_INT_CTRL.name: R8_PWM_INT_CTRL
R8_PWM_INT_CTRL.info: PWMx interrupt control and status register

bits_fields.name: R16_PWM9_REG_DATA
bits_fields.description: [translate:16-bit bit data of PWM9 channel.]

bits_fields.name: R16_PWM8_REG_DATA
bits_fields.description: [translate:16-bit bit data of PWM8 channel.]

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: [translate:Reserved]

bits_fields.name: RB_PWM_CYC_VALUE
bits_fields.description: [translate:PWM clock period at 16 data width.]

bits_fields.name: SWRST
bits_fields.description: Software reset. When user codes set this bit, I2C is reset. Before reset, make sure that IIC lines are released and the bus is idle.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: This bit can reset I2C when no Stop condition is detected on the bus but the busy bit is 1.

bits_fields.name: ALERT
bits_fields.description: SMBus alert. This bit can be set or cleared by user codes. After the PE bit is set, this bit can be cleared by hardware. 1: Drive SMBusALERT pin low, response address header followed by ACK; 0: Release SMBusALERT pin high, response address header followed by NACK.

bits_fields.name: PEC
bits_fields.description: Data packet error checking enable, it is set to enable data packet error checking detection. This bit can be set or cleared by user codes. After PEC is transmitted, or when a Start or Stop condition is generated, or when the PE bit is cleared to 0, this bit is cleared by hardware. 1: PEC; 0: No PEC. Note: PEC is corrupted when an arbitration is lost.

bits_fields.name: POS
bits_fields.description: ACK/PEC position. This bit can be set or cleared by user codes. Or this bit can be cleared by hardware after PE is cleared. 1: The ACK bit controls ACK/NAK of the next byte that is received in the shift register. The next byte that is received in PEC shift register is a PEC; 0: The ACK bit controls ACK/NAK of the current byte being received in the shift register. The PEC bits indicates that current byte in the shift register is a PEC.

bits_fields.name: ACK
bits_fields.description: Acknowledge enable. This bit can be set or cleared by user codes. Or this bit can be cleared by hardware after PE is set. 1: Acknowledge returned after a byte is received; 0: No acknowledge.

bits_fields.name: STOP
bits_fields.description: Stop condition generation. This bit can be set or cleared by user codes. Or this bit can be cleared by hardware when a Stop condition is detected. Or this bit can be set by hardware when a timeout error is detected. In master mode: 1: A Stop condition is generated during current byte transmission or after current Start condition is sent; 0: No Stop condition generated. In slave mode: 1: Release SCL and SDA after current byte transmission; 0: No Stop condition generated.

bits_fields.name: START
bits_fields.description: Start condition generation. This bit can be set or cleared by user codes. Or this bit can be cleared by hardware when a Start condition is sent or PE is cleared. In master mode: 1: Repeated Start condition generation; 0: No Start condition generation. In slave mode: 1: A Start condition is generated when the bus is idle; 0: No Start condition generated.

bits_fields.name: NOSTRETCH
bits_fields.description: Clock stretching disable. This bit can be used to disable clock stretching when ADDB or BTF flag is set, until it is cleared by software. 1: Disable clock stretching; 0: Enable clock stretching.

bits_fields.name: ENGC
bits_fields.description: General call enable. This can be set to enable general call. Response general address 00h.

bits_fields.name: ENPEC
bits_fields.description: PEC enable. This bit can be set to enable PEC calculation.

bits_fields.name: ENARP
bits_fields.description: ARP enable. This bit can be set to enable ARP. If SMBTYPE=0, use default SMBus device address; If SMBTYPE=1, use SMBus host address.

bits_fields.name: SMBTYPE
bits_fields.description: SMBus device type. 1: SMBus host; 0: SMBus device.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: SMBUS
bits_fields.description: SMBus mode selection: 1: SMBus mode; 0: I2C mode.

bits_fields.name: PE
bits_fields.description: I2C peripheral enable. 1: I2C enabled; 0: I2C disabled.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: ITBUFEN
bits_fields.description: Buffer interrupt enable. 1: When TxE or RxEN is set, event interrupt is generated; 0: no interrupt is generated.

bits_fields.name: ITEVTEN
bits_fields.description: Event interrupt enable. Interrupt is generated for events: SB=1 (Master); ADDR=1 (Master/Slave); ADDR10=1 (Master); STOPF=1 (Slave); BTF=1 without TxE or RxEN event; TxE=1 or RxNE=1 if ITBUFEN=1.

bits_fields.name: ITERREN
bits_fields.description: Error interrupt enable. Interrupt generated on BERR=1; ARLO=1; AF=1; OVR=1; PECERR=1; TIMEOUT=1; SMBAlert=1.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: FREQ
bits_fields.description: I2C clock frequency. Set between 2~36 MHz. Must be between 000010b and 100100b. Recommended minimum 2 MHz for standard mode and 4 MHz for fast mode.

bits_fields.name: ADDMODE
bits_fields.description: Addressing mode. 1: 10-bit slave address (7-bit address not acknowledged); 0: 7-bit slave address (10-bit address not acknowledged).

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: ADD9_8
bits_fields.description: Bus address bits 9 and 8 used when 10-bit addressing mode is selected. Ignored in 7-bit addressing mode.

bits_fields.name: ADD7_1
bits_fields.description: Bus address bits 7 to 1.

bits_fields.name: ADD0
bits_fields.description: Bus address bit 0 when using 10-bit addressing mode. Ignored in 7-bit addressing mode.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: ADD2
bits_fields.description: Bus address bits 7 to 1 in dual addressing mode.

bits_fields.name: ENDUAL
bits_fields.description: Dual addressing mode enable bit. Set to enable recognition of ADD2 address.

bits_fields.name: DATAR
bits_fields.description: Data register. It can be used to store the received data or store the data to be sent to the bus.

bits_fields.name: SMBALERT
bits_fields.description: SMBus alert. This bit can be reset by user codes writing 0, or reset by hardware when PE is at low level. In SMBus host mode: 1 means SMBus alert occurs; 0 means no SMBus alert. In SMBus slave mode: 1 means SMBAlert response address header to SMBAlert LOW received; 0 means no SMBAlert response address header received.

bits_fields.name: TIMEOUT
bits_fields.description: Timeout or Tlow error flag. This bit can be reset by user codes writing 0, or reset by hardware when PE is at low level. 1 means SCL remained LOW for 25ms, or master low extend time more than 10ms, or slave low extend time more than 25ms; 0 means no timeout error. Note: When this bit is set in slave mode, slave resets communication, lines are released by hardware. When this bit is set in host mode, a Stop condition is sent by hardware.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: PECERR
bits_fields.description: PEC error flag in reception. This bit can be reset by user codes writing 0, or reset by hardware when PE is at low level. 1 means PEC error, NAK returned after PEC is received; 0 means no PEC error.

bits_fields.name: OVR
bits_fields.description: Overrun/Underrun flag. 1 means overrun/underrun: If NOSTRETCH=1, when a new byte is received in reception and data register has not been read, the new received byte is lost. In transmission, when no new data is written into data register, the same byte is sent twice; 0 means no overrun/underrun.

bits_fields.name: AF
bits_fields.description: Acknowledge failure flag. This bit can be reset by user codes writing 0, or reset by hardware when PE is at low level. 1 means acknowledge failure; 0 means no acknowledge failure.

bits_fields.name: ARLO
bits_fields.description: Arbitration lost flag. This bit can be reset by user codes writing 0, or reset by hardware when PE is at low level. 1 means arbitration lost detected, the interface loses control of the bus; 0 means arbitration is normal.

bits_fields.name: BERR
bits_fields.description: Bus error flag. This bit can be reset by user codes writing 0, or reset by hardware when PE is at low level. 1 means start/stop condition error; 0 means normal.

bits_fields.name: TxE
bits_fields.description: Data register empty flag. It can be cleared by writing data to the data register, or cleared by hardware after a Start/Stop condition is generated or when PE is 0. 1 means data register empty in transmission.

bits_fields.name: RxNE
bits_fields.description: Data register not empty flag. It can be cleared by reading/writing data to the data register, or cleared by hardware when PE is 0. 1 means data register not empty in reception; 0 means normal.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: STOPF
bits_fields.description: Stop condition flag. It can be cleared by a write operation to control register 1 after user reads status register 1, or cleared by hardware when PE is 0. 1 means slave detects a Stop condition on the bus after an acknowledge; 0 means no Stop condition detected.

bits_fields.name: ADD10
bits_fields.description: 10-bit address header sent flag. It can be cleared by write operation to control register 1 after user reads status register 1, or cleared by hardware when PE is 0. 1 means in 10-bit addressing mode, slave has sent first address byte; 0 means none.

bits_fields.name: BTF
bits_fields.description: Byte transmission finished flag. It can be cleared by read/write operation to the data register after user reads status register 1. In transmission, it can be cleared by hardware after a Start/Stop condition is generated or when PE is 0. 1 means byte transmission finished.

bits_fields.name: ADDR
bits_fields.description: Address sent/matched flag. It can be cleared by read operation to status register 2 after user reads status register 1, or cleared by hardware when PE is 0. In master mode: 1 means address transmission finished: in 10-bit mode, bit set after ACK of second address byte; in 7-bit mode, bit set after ACK of byte received; 0 means address transmission not finished. In slave mode: 1 means received address matched; 0 means start bit not sent.

bits_fields.name: SB
bits_fields.description: Start bit sent flag. It can be cleared by write operation to data register after user reads status register 1, or cleared by hardware when PE is 0. 1 means start bit sent; 0 means start bit not sent.

bits_fields.name: PEC
bits_fields.description: Packet error checking register. When PEC is enabled (ENPEC is set), this register stores the value of PEC.

bits_fields.name: DUALF
bits_fields.description: Dual flag. It can be cleared by hardware when a Stop/Start bit is generated or when PE=0. 1 means received address matched with OADDR2; 0 means received address matched with OADDR1.

bits_fields.name: SMBHOST
bits_fields.description: SMBus host header flag. It can be cleared by hardware when a Stop/Start bit is generated or when PE=0. 1 means when SMBTYPE=1 and ENARP=1, SMBus host address received; 0 means SMBus host address not received.

bits_fields.name: SMBDEFAULT
bits_fields.description: SMBus device default address flag. It can be cleared by hardware when a Stop/Start bit is generated or when PE=0. 1 means when ENARP=1, SMBus device default address received; 0 means SMBus device default address not received.

bits_fields.name: GENCALL
bits_fields.description: General call address flag. It can be cleared by hardware when a Stop/Start bit is generated or when PE=0. 1 means when ENGC=1, general call address received; 0 means general call address not received.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: TRA
bits_fields.description: Transmission/reception flag. It can be cleared by hardware when a Stop condition is detected (STOPF=1) or repeated Start condition is detected or an arbitration lost is detected (ARLO=1) or when PE=0. 1 means data transmitted; 0 means data received.

bits_fields.name: BUSY
bits_fields.description: Bus busy flag. It can be cleared when a Stop condition is detected. When the interface is disabled (PE=0), the information is still updated. 1 means busy bus: SDA or SCL LOW; 0 means idle bus, and no communication.

bits_fields.name: MSL
bits_fields.description: Master/slave mode indication. It can be cleared by hardware when the interface is in Master mode (SB=1). It can be cleared by hardware when the bus detects a Stop bit or an arbitration lost or when PE=0.

bits_fields.name: F/S
bits_fields.description: Master mode selection: 1 for Fast mode; 0 for Standard mode.

bits_fields.name: DUTY
bits_fields.description: Clock HIGH duty cycle in fast mode: 1 for 36%; 0 for 33.3%.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: CCR
bits_fields.description: Clock frequency division factor register, which decides frequency wave of SCL clock.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: TRISE
bits_fields.description: Maximum rise time. These bits set the rise time of SCL in master mode. The maximum rise time equals TRISE minus single clock cycle. This bit can be set only when PE is cleared.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.description: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: LCD_SEG_EN_19_16
bits_fields.description: SEG16-SEG19 segment enable.

bits_fields.name: LCD_SEG_EN_15_8
bits_fields.description: SEG8-SEG15 segment enable.

bits_fields.name: LCD_SEG_EN_7_0
bits_fields.description: SEG0-SEG7 segment enable.

bits_fields.name: VLCD_SEL
bits_fields.description: LCD drive voltage selection: 0 for 3.3V; 1 for 2.5V.

bits_fields.name: SCAN_CLK_SEL
bits_fields.description: Scan clock selection: 00 for 256Hz; 01 for 512Hz; 10 for 1KHz; 11 for 128Hz.

bits_fields.name: LCD_DUTY
bits_fields.description: LCD duty cycle selection: 00 for 1/2; 01 for 1/3; 10 for 1/4; 11 is invalid.

bits_fields.name: LCD_BIAS
bits_fields.description: Bias ratio selection: 0 for 1/2; 1 for 1/3.

bits_fields.name: LCD_ON
bits_fields.description: LCD switch: 1 to enable; 0 to disable.

bits_fields.name: SYS_EN
bits_fields.description: System enable: 1 to enable; 0 to disable.

bits_fields.name: LCD_SEGX
bits_fields.description: Data in SEG0-SEG7 segments, 4 bits per segment. Reset value 00000000h.

bits_fields.name: LCD_SEGX
bits_fields.description: Data in SEG8-SEG15 segments, 4 bits per segment.

bits_fields.name: LCD_SEGX
bits_fields.description: Data in SEG16-SEG19 segments, 4 bits per segment.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: IWDG_KR
bits_fields.info: KEY[15:0]: key value (write register only, read out value is 0x0000). The software must write 0xAAAA at certain intervals to reload the count value, otherwise, when the counter is 0, the watchdog will generate a reset. Writing 0x5555 indicates that the protection is lifted. Write 0xCCCC to start the watchdog work (if the hardware watchdog is selected, it is not restricted by this command word).

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: IWDG_EN
bits_fields.info: Watchdog start switch: 1 means on; 0 means off.

bits_fields.name: WR_PROTECT
bits_fields.info: Write protection: 1 means prohibit operation of the corresponding field; 0 means unprotected.

bits_fields.name: STOP_EN
bits_fields.info: Watchdog stop enable (write protection exists): 0 means turn off the stop switch; 1 means turn on the stop switch.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: COUNT
bits_fields.info: Watchdog decrement counter.

bits_fields.name: PVU
bits_fields.info: Configuration register update flag bit (write protection exists): 1 means register is updated; 0 means register is not updated.

bits_fields.name: PR
bits_fields.info: Prescaling factor (write protection exists): Values from 000 (divided by 4) to 111 (divided by 512).

bits_fields.name: RLR
bits_fields.info: Watchdog counter reload (with write protection). Defines the reload value of the watchdog counter. When 0xAAAA is written to the IWDG_KR register, the reload value is transferred to the counter which counts decrementally from this value. The watchdog timeout period can be calculated from this reload value and the clock prescaler value.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_CH_INX
bits_fields.info: ADC channel index number, a total of 14 channels: 00h-0Dh: External signal channels AIN0~AIN13; 0Eh: Battery voltage VBAT; 0Fh: Built-in temperature sensor TS. CH591 only supports AIN0 ~ AIN5, VBAT and TS.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_CLK_DIV
bits_fields.info: ADC clock frequency selection: 00 is CK32M divided by 10, 3.2MHz; 01 is CK32M divided by 4, 8MHz; 10 is CK32M divided by 6, 5.33MHz; 11 is CK32M divided by 8, 4MHz. The actual sampling rate is approximately 1/18 of the clock frequency.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_PGA_GAIN
bits_fields.info: ADC input PGA gain selection: When RB_ADC_PGA_GAIN[2]=0, 00 is -12dB (1/4 gain), 01 is -6dB (1/2 gain), 10 is 0dB (no gain), 11 is 6dB (2x gain). When RB_ADC_PGA_GAIN[2]=1, 00 is 6dB (2x), 01 is 12dB (4x), 10 is 18dB (8x), 11 is 24dB (16x).

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_OFS_TEST
bits_fields.info: ADC offset error test mode: 1 enables test/calibrate mode where lower 12-bit data of data register R16_ADC_DATA is bitwise inverted (e.g., 0x0573 to 0x0A8C); 0 is normal mode.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_DIFF_EN
bits_fields.info: ADC channel signal input mode: 1 for differential input; 0 for single-ended input.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_BUF_EN
bits_fields.info: ADC input buffer BUF enable: 1 to enable; 0 to disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_POWER_ON
bits_fields.info: ADC module power enable: 1 to power on; 0 to power off.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_PGA_GAIN[2]
bits_fields.info: ADC's input PGA gain direction selection, combined with RB_ADC_PGA_GAIN[1:0]. Note: This bit must be 0 when using TS, i.e. RB_ADC_PGA_GAIN[2:0]=011b when using TS.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_START
bits_fields.info: ADC conversion enable control and status. It is cleared automatically when non-continuous ADC ends or when DMA ends: 1 means start conversion or being converted; 0 means stop conversion.

bits_fields.name: RB_TEM_SEN_PWR_ON
bits_fields.info: TS temperature sensor power enable control: 1 means enabled; 0 means disable.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_DATA
bits_fields.info: Data after ADC conversion.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_IF_EOC
bits_fields.info: ADC conversion finished flag. This flag can be cleared by writing to register R8_ADC_CONVERT or R8_TKEY_CONVERT.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_AUTO_EN
bits_fields.info: Automatic continuous ADC sampling enable at timing interval: 1 for enable automatic ADC; 0 for disable automatic ADC.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_CONT_EN
bits_fields.info: ADC continuous conversion mode enable: 1 for enable continuous ADC; 0 for disable continuous ADC.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_IE_EOC
bits_fields.info: ADC conversion completion interrupt enable: 1 for enable interrupt; 0 for disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_IE_DMA_END
bits_fields.info: DMA end interrupt enable: 1 for enable interrupt; 0 for disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_DMA_LOOP
bits_fields.info: DMA address loop enable: 1 for enable address loop; 0 for disable address loop. If the DMA address loop is enabled, when the DMA address reaches the set end address, it will automatically loop to the start address that is set.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_DMA_ENABLE
bits_fields.info: DMA function enable: 1 for enable DMA; 0 for disable DMA.

R8_ADC_DMA_IF.name: R8_ADC_DMA_IF
R8_ADC_DMA_IF.info: ADC and DMA interrupt flag register

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_IF_END_ADC
bits_fields.info: ADC conversion completion interrupt flag, write 1 to clear or when data is taken by DMA or write to register R8_ADC_CONVERT.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_IF_DMA_END
bits_fields.info: DMA completion flag. Write 1 to reset: 1 means DMA has been completed; 0 means not completed.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: R8_ADC_AUTO_CYCLE
bits_fields.info: [translate:The starting value of continuous ADC timing cycle is counted in unit of 16 system clocks and reloaded after reaching 256. Calculation: timing =(256-R8_ADC_AUTO_CYCLE)*16*Tsys Counts in units of 32MHz clock at the start value of continuous TKEY timing cycles. Calculation method: Timing = R8_ADC_AUTO_CYCLE*TCK32M.]

R16_ADC_DMA_NOW.name: R16_ADC_DMA_NOW
R16_ADC_DMA_NOW.info: Current buffer address of DMA register

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: R16_ADC_DMA_NOW
bits_fields.info: [translate:Current address of DMA data buffer. It can be used to calculate the number of conversions. Calculation: COUNT=(ADC_DMA_NOW - ADC_DMA_BEG)/2.]

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: R16_ADC_DMA_BEG
bits_fields.info: DMA data buffer start address, the address must be 2-byte aligned.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: R16_ADC_DMA_END
bits_fields.info: DMA data buffer end address (not included), address must be 2-byte aligned.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH8
bits_fields.info: Channel 8 analog input channel select bit: 0000: AIN0, 0001: AIN1, 0010: AIN2, 0011: AIN3, 0100: AIN4, 0101: AIN5, 0110: Reserved, 0111: Reserved, 1000: AIN8, 1001: AIN9, 1010: AIN10, 1011: AIN11, 1100: AIN12, 1101: AIN13, 1110: Battery voltage VBAT, 1111: Built-in temperature sensor TS.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH7
bits_fields.info: Channel 7 analog input channel select bit, same encoding as Channel 8.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH6
bits_fields.info: Channel 6 analog input channel select bit, same encoding as Channel 8.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH5
bits_fields.info: Channel 5 analog input channel select bit, same encoding as Channel 8.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH4
bits_fields.info: Channel 4 analog input channel select bit, same encoding as Channel 8.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH3
bits_fields.info: Channel 3 analog input channel select bit, same encoding as Channel 8.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH2
bits_fields.info: Channel 2 analog input channel select bit, same encoding as Channel 8.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH1
bits_fields.info: Channel 1 analog input channel select bit, same encoding as Channel 8.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_IF_SCAN_END
bits_fields.info: Scan end flag, 1 indicates the end of the scan. Writing 1 to this bit clears it, writing 0 has no effect.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_IE_SCAN_END
bits_fields.info: End-of-scan interrupt enable: 0 means disabled, 1 means enabled.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_SEL
bits_fields.info: Scan function selection: 0 for TKEY, 1 for ADC.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_QU
bits_fields.info: Number of scan channels.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH11
bits_fields.info: Channel 11 analog input channel select bit with options from AIN0 to TS (temperature sensor) and VBAT (battery voltage).

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH10
bits_fields.info: Channel 10 analog input channel select bit, same options as channel 11.

bits_fields.name: RB_ADC_SCAN_CH9
bits_fields.info: Channel 9 analog input channel select bit, same options as channel 11.

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_DISCH_CNT
bits_fields.info: The number of Touch-Key discharge cycles, counting in unit of ADC clock selected by RB_ADC_CLK_DIV. Calculation: discharge time = (RB_TKEY_DISCH_CNT+1)*Tadc.

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_CHARG_CNT
bits_fields.info: The number of Touch-Key charge cycles, counting in unit of ADC clock selected by RB_ADC_CLK_DIV. Calculation: charge time = (RB_TKEY_CHARG_CNT+4)*Tadc.

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_START
bits_fields.info: TouchKey detection control and status, automatically cleared: 1 means start to detect/being converted; 0 means stop converting.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_DMA_EN
bits_fields.info: TouchKey DMA enable: 1 to enable; 0 to disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_AUTO_EN
bits_fields.info: TouchKey auto-trigger enable.

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_RAND_EN
bits_fields.info: TouchKey RAND enable: 1 to enable; 0 to disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_PGA_ADJ
bits_fields.info: Select the operating speed of PGA in ADC: 1 is high speed but slightly larger power consumption; 0 is normal speed.

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_DRV_EN
bits_fields.info: TouchKey driver shielding enable.

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_CURRENT
bits_fields.info: TouchKey charge current selection: 1 means 60% current; 0 means rated current.

bits_fields.name: RB_TKEY_PWR_ON
bits_fields.info: TouchKey module power enable control: 1 to enable; 0 to disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_UC_HOST_MODE
bits_fields.info: USB working mode selection: 1 for HOST; 0 for DEVICE.

bits_fields.name: RB_UC_LOW_SPEED
bits_fields.info: USB bus signal transmission rate selection: 1 for 1.5Mbps (low speed), 0 for 12Mbps (full speed).

bits_fields.name: RB_UC_DEV_PU_EN
bits_fields.info: USB device enable and internal pull-up resistor control in USB device mode. When set to 1, USB device transmission is enabled and internal pull-up resistor also enabled. RB_PIN_USB_DP_PU can substitute this bit.

bits_fields.name: MASK_UC_SYS_CTRL
bits_fields.info: USB system configuration. See datasheet table for detailed options. Reset value 00b.

bits_fields.name: RB_UC_INT_BUSY
bits_fields.info: Auto pause enable before USB transmission completion interrupt flag is not cleared: 1 means it will automatically pause before the interrupt flag UIF_TRANSFER is cleared. In device mode, it automatically responds to busy NAK; in host mode, it automatically pauses subsequent transmission; 0 disables pause.

bits_fields.name: RB_UC_RESET_SIE
bits_fields.info: Software reset control of USB protocol processor (SIE): 1 forces reset; software must clear it; 0 means no reset.

bits_fields.name: RB_UC_CLR_ALL
bits_fields.info: USB FIFO and interrupt flag clear: 1 forces empty and clear all; 0 means no clear.

bits_fields.name: RB_UC_DMA_EN
bits_fields.info: USB DMA and DMA interrupt control: 1 enables DMA functionality and interrupt; 0 disables DMA.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIE_DEV_NAK
bits_fields.info: In USB device mode, receive NAK interrupt enable: 1 to enable interrupt; 0 to disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_MOD_1_WIRE
bits_fields.info: USB single line mode enable: 1 to enable; 0 to disable.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIE_FIFO_OV
bits_fields.info: FIFO overflow interrupt enable: 1 to enable interrupt; 0 to disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIE_HST_SOF
bits_fields.info: In USB host mode, SOF timing interrupt enable: 1 to enable interrupt; 0 to disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIE_SUSPEND
bits_fields.info: USB bus suspend or wake-up event interrupt enable: 1 to enable interrupt; 0 to disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIE_TRANSFER
bits_fields.info: USB transfer completion interrupt enable: 1 to enable interrupt; 0 to disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIE_DETECT
bits_fields.info: In USB host mode, USB device connection or disconnection event interrupt enable: 1 to enable interrupt; 0 to disable interrupt.

bits_fields.name: RB_UDA_GP_BIT
bits_fields.info: USB general flag, user-defined.

bits_fields.name: MASK_USB_ADDR
bits_fields.info: Host mode: address of USB device currently operated; Device mode: the address of the USB itself.

bits_fields.name: RB_UMS_SOF_PRES
bits_fields.info: SOF packet indication status in USB host mode: 1 means SOF packet will be sent and it will be automatically delayed if there are other USB data packets; 0 means no SOF packet is sent.

bits_fields.name: RB_UMS_SOF_ACT
bits_fields.info: SOF packet transmission status in USB host mode: 1 means SOF packet is being sent out; 0 means the transmission is completed or idle.

bits_fields.name: RB_UMS_SIE_FREE
bits_fields.info: USB protocol processor free status: 1 means free; 0 means busy, USB transmission is in progress.

bits_fields.name: RB_UMS_R_FIFO_RDY
bits_fields.info: USB receiver FIFO data ready status: 1 means receiver FIFO not empty; 0 means receiver FIFO empty.

bits_fields.name: RB_UMS_BUS_RESET
bits_fields.info: USB bus reset status: 1 means the current USB bus is at reset status; 0 means the current USB bus is at non-reset status.

bits_fields.name: RB_UMS_SUSPEND
bits_fields.info: USB suspend status: 1 means the USB bus is in suspended status with no USB activity for a period; 0 means the USB bus is in non-suspended status.

bits_fields.name: RB_UMS_DM_LEVEL
bits_fields.info: In USB host mode, the level status of the DM pin when the device is just connected to the USB port, used to determine speed: 1 means High level/low-speed; 0 means Low level/full-speed.

bits_fields.name: RB_UMS_DEV_ATTACH
bits_fields.info: USB device connection status of the port in USB host mode: 1 means the port has been connected to a USB device; 0 means no USB device is connected to the port.

bits_fields.name: RB_U_IS_NAK
bits_fields.info: In USB device mode, NAK acknowledge status: 1 indicates NAK acknowledge during current USB transmission; 0 indicates no NAK acknowledge.

bits_fields.name: RB_U_TOG_OK
bits_fields.info: Current USB transmission DATA0/1 synchronous flag match status: 1 indicates synchronous; 0 indicates asynchronous.

bits_fields.name: RB_U_SIE_FREE
bits_fields.info: USB protocol processor idle status: 1 indicates USB idle; 0 indicates busy, USB transmission is in progress.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIF_FIFO_OV
bits_fields.info: USB FIFO overflow interrupt flag. Writing 1 resets the flag: 1 indicates FIFO overflow triggered; 0 indicates no event.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIF_HST_SOF
bits_fields.info: SOF timing interrupt flag in USB host mode. Writing 1 resets the flag: 1 indicates SOF packet transmission completion triggered; 0 indicates no event.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIF_SUSPEND
bits_fields.info: USB bus suspend or wake-up event interrupt flag. Writing 1 resets the flag: 1 indicates USB suspend or wake-up event trigger; 0 indicates no event.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIF_TRANSFER
bits_fields.info: USB transmission completion interrupt flag. Writing 1 resets the flag: 1 indicates USB transmission completion triggered; 0 indicates no event.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIF_DETECT
bits_fields.info: In USB host mode, USB device connection or disconnection event interrupt flag. Writing 1 resets the flag: 1 indicates USB device connection or disconnection detected; 0 indicates no event.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIF_BUS_RST
bits_fields.info: USB bus reset event interrupt flag in USB device mode. Writing 1 resets the flag: 1 indicates USB bus reset event triggered; 0 indicates no event.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIS_SETUP_ACT
bits_fields.info: In USB device mode, when this bit is 1, 8-byte SETUP request packet has been successfully received. SETUP token does not affect RB_UIS_TOG_OK, MASK_UIS_TOKEN, MASK_UIS_ENDP and R8_USB_RX_LEN.

bits_fields.name: RB_UIS_TOG_OK
bits_fields.info: Current USB transmission DATA0/1 synchronization flag matching status. Same as RB_U_TOG_OK: 1 means synchronous; 0 means asynchronous.

bits_fields.name: MASK_UIS_TOKEN
bits_fields.info: In device mode, the token PID of the current USB transfer transaction.

bits_fields.name: MASK_UIS_ENDP
bits_fields.info: In device mode, the endpoint number of the current USB transfer transaction. In host mode, the response PID identification of the current USB transfer transaction: 0000 means no response or timeout; others mean respond PID.

bits_fields.name: R8_USB_RX_LEN
bits_fields.info: The number of data bytes received by the current USB endpoint.

bits_fields.name: R16_UEPn_DMA
bits_fields.info: Endpoint n buffer start address. The address must be 4-byte aligned.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: R8_UEPn_T_LEN
bits_fields.info: Set the number of data bytes that USB endpoint n is ready to send.

bits_fields.name: RB_UEP_R_TOG
bits_fields.info: Expected synchronization trigger bit of the receiver (process OUT transactions) of USB endpoint n: 1: Expect DATA1; 0: Expect DATA0.

bits_fields.name: RB_UEP_T_TOG
bits_fields.info: Synchronization trigger bit of the transmitter (process IN transactions) of USB endpoint n: 1: Transmit DATA1; 0: Transmit DATA0.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_UEP_AUTO_TOG
bits_fields.info: Synchronization trigger bit auto flip enable control bit: 1: After data is sent or received successfully, the corresponding synchronization trigger bit is automatically flipped; 0: Not flipped automatically, can be switched manually. It only supports endpoint 1/2/3/5/6/7.

bits_fields.name: MASK_UEP_R_RES
bits_fields.info: Control on response to OUT transactions by the receiver of USB endpoint n: 00: Respond ACK; 01: Timeout/no response (used for real-time/synchronous transmission of non-endpoint 0); 10: Respond to NAK or busy; 11: Respond to STALL or error.

bits_fields.name: MASK_UEP_T_RES
bits_fields.info: Control on response to IN transactions of the transmitter of endpoint n: 00: DATA0/DATA1 data ready and ACK expected; 01: Respond to DATA0/DATA1 and expect no response (for real-time/synchronous transmission of non-endpoint 0); 10: Respond to NAK or busy; 11: Respond to STALL or error.

bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_UH_LOW_SPEED
bits_fields.info: USB host port low-speed mode enable bit: 1: Select 1.5Mbps low-speed mode; 0: Select 12Mbps full-speed mode.

bits_fields.name: RB_UH_BUS_RESET
bits_fields.info: USB host mode bus reset: 1: Output USB bus reset by force; 0: End output.

bits_fields.name: RB_UH_PORT_EN
bits_fields.info: USB host port enable: 1: Enable the host port; 0: Disable the host port. The bit is automatically cleared to 0 when the USB device is disconnected.

bits_fields.info: Reserved.

R16_UH_TX_DMA.info: USB host transmit buffer start address]

bits_fields.name: R16_UH_TX_DMA
bits_fields.info: Host endpoint data transmit buffer start address. The lower 15 bits are valid, and the address must be 4 bytes aligned.

bits_fields.name: RB_UH_PRE_PID_EN
bits_fields.info: Low-speed preamble packet PRE PID enable bit: 1: Enable, used to communicate with low-speed USB device through an external HUB; 0: Disable the low-speed preamble packet.

bits_fields.name: RB_UH_SOF_EN
bits_fields.info: Automatically generate SOF packet enable bit: 1: The host automatically generates SOF packet; 0: The host does not automatically generate SOF packet, but can generate manually.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: MASK_UH_TOKEN
bits_fields.info: Set the token PID packet identification of this USB transmission transaction.

bits_fields.name: MASK_UH_ENDP
bits_fields.info: Set the endpoint number of the target device being operated this time.

R8_UH_RX_CTRL.name: R8_UH_RX_CTRL
R8_UH_RX_CTRL.info: USB host reception endpoint control registe

bits_fields.name: RB_UH_R_TOG

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_UH_R_AUTO_TOG
bits_fields.info: Synchronization trigger bit auto toggle enable control bit: 1: After data is successfully received, the expected synchronization trigger bit (RB_UH_R_TOG) is automatically toggled; 0: Not toggled automatically but can be switched manually.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_UH_R_RES
bits_fields.info: Control on response to IN transactions by host receiver: 1: No response, used for real-time/synchronous transmission of non-endpoint 0; 0: Respond to ACK.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: R8_UH_TX_LEN
bits_fields.info: Set the number of data bytes that USB host transmission endpoint is ready to send.

R8_UH_TX_CTRL.name: R8_UH_TX_CTRL
R8_UH_TX_CTRL.info: USB host transmission endpoint control registe

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved synchronization trigger bit prepared by USB host transmitter.

bits_fields.name: RB_UH_T_TOG
bits_fields.info: Synchronization trigger bit prepared by USB host transmitter (process SETUP/OUT transactions): 1: Transmit DATA1; 0: Transmit DATA0.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_UH_T_AUTO_TOG
bits_fields.info: Synchronization trigger bit auto toggle enable control bit: 1: Corresponding synchronization trigger bit (RB_UH_T_TOG) toggled after data is sent successfully; 0: Not toggled automatically, can be switched manually.

bits_fields.name: Reserved
bits_fields.info: Reserved.

bits_fields.name: RB_UH_T_RES
bits_fields.info: Response control bit of USB host transmitter to SETUP/OUT transactions: 1: Expect no response, used for real-time/synchronous transmission endpoint 0; 0: Expect to respond to ACK.
